title: [enhancement](session variables) we can filter session variables  by changed column now
body:
1. show variables support using where changed=1 to filter result;
2. fix select * from information_schema.session_variables

```txt
mysql [(none)]>show variables where changed=1;
--------------
show variables where changed=1
--------------

Empty set (0.01 sec)

mysql [(none)]>set runtime_filter_type='BLOOM_FILTER';
--------------
set runtime_filter_type='BLOOM_FILTER'
--------------

Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.00 sec)

mysql [(none)]>show variables where changed=1;
--------------
show variables where changed=1
--------------

+---------------------+--------------+--------------------+---------+
| Variable_name       | Value        | Default_Value      | Changed |
+---------------------+--------------+--------------------+---------+
| runtime_filter_type | BLOOM_FILTER | IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER | 1       |
+---------------------+--------------+--------------------+---------+
1 row in set (0.02 sec)

mysql [(none)]>select * from information_schema.session_variables where changed=1;
--------------
select * from information_schema.session_variables where changed=1
--------------

+---------------------+----------------+--------------------+---------+
| VARIABLE_NAME       | VARIABLE_VALUE | DEFAULT_VALUE      | CHANGED |
+---------------------+----------------+--------------------+---------+
| runtime_filter_type | BLOOM_FILTER   | IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER | 1       |
+---------------------+----------------+--------------------+---------+
1 row in set (0.03 sec)
```
NOTE:
test in regression-test/data/variable_p0/set_and_unset_variable.out is strange.
According to my test, the default value of runtime_filter_type of CI should be 12, so we should have IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER,MINMAX as decoded result, but result in current probe file `set_and_unset_variable.data` is IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER. 
And after I added new test in the same file, CI tells me the result of my new test should be as follows
```txt
Exception:
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Check tag 'cmd' failed:
Check tag 'cmd' failed, line 1, CHAR result mismatch.
Expect cell is: IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER
But real is: IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER,MIN_MAX line 1 mismatch
ExpectRow: [runtime_filter_type, BLOOM_FILTER, IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER, 1]
RealRow: [runtime_filter_type, BLOOM_FILTER, IN_OR_BLOOM_FILTER,MIN_MAX, 1]
sql:
show session variables where variable_name='runtime_filter_type'
```
It hard to explain why existing test is OK ...

title: [fix](dynamic partition) fix create too many dynamic partitions
body:
For dynamic partitions,  the expect created partition num = dynamic_partition.end - dynamic_partition.start.
By default,  fe limit 500(Config.max_dynamic_partition_num) dynamic partitions.

But if dynamic_partition.start is near  int.min_value the expect create partition num will be overflow and become a negative number.  Then check created partition num < Config.max_dynamic_partition_num is ok.

For example:  if start = -2147483647 (int.min_value + 1) end = 1, then end - start =   -2147483648 < 0

So change the expect create partition num to long to avoid overflow.


## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [fix](pipeline) Set the flag of short circuit only when hash join sink finished
body:
## Proposed changes

If the hash build sink process isn't complete, setting `_short_circuit_for_probe` to true is incorrect.

```
 0# doris::signal::(anonymous namespace)::FailureSignalHandler(int, siginfo_t*, void*) at /root/doris/be/src/common/signal_handler.h:417
 1# 0x00007F1FD3E87090 in /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6
 2# raise at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:51
 3# abort at /build/glibc-SzIz7B/glibc-2.31/stdlib/abort.c:81
 4# 0x000055B8426B89CD in /mnt/hdd01/ci/master-deploy/be/lib/doris_be
 5# 0x000055B8426AB06A in /mnt/hdd01/ci/master-deploy/be/lib/doris_be
 6# google::LogMessage::SendToLog() in /mnt/hdd01/ci/master-deploy/be/lib/doris_be
 7# google::LogMessage::Flush() in /mnt/hdd01/ci/master-deploy/be/lib/doris_be
```

title: [improvement](hudi)Obtain partition information through HMS's API
body:
## Proposed changes

When a Hudi table is synchronized to HMS, the partition information is also synchronized, so even if the metastore is not enabled in the Hudi table (for example, if the Metastore is false for a Hudi table created with Flink), you can still obtain the partition information through the HMS API.

## Proposed changes

It's time to replace BITMAP INDEX with INVERTED INDEX, since INVERTED INDEX is production ready in 2.0 version.

For compatibility, 
1. already created BITMAP INDEX can still be used BUT users can not create new BITMAP INDEX any more. 
2. If the user use the `USING BITMAP INDEX` to create index, a INVERTED INDEX is created actually, to avoid error and get a similar query acceleration.

For the further version, `BITMAP INDEX` will be completely removed.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Bug] doris cloud ms does not start even though process is not running
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #30945 

if doris_cloud is not running then the old pid file should be removed and proceed to start the process.

pgrep matches the pid, this will not work; pgrep matched on process name
the existing code can we modified to fix this,
if ! pgrep -f doris_cloud 2>&1 | grep "${pid}" >/dev/null 2>&1; then

but this change also is not correct. if there is another process by the name doris_cloud then pgrep will return incorrect pid, which will again cause incorrect behavior.
rather than using pgrep, we should use kill command, passing the doris_cloud pid file as input.

## Further comments

If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [Fix](load) fix load channel leak when load exception occurs
body:
## Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

<!--Describe your changes.-->
This was introduced by: #27111
When an exception occurs during load, only _cancel is set to true without calling the tablet_writer_cancel request, resulting in load channel not being released.
